metadata.title: CVE-2017-5391 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Special "about:" pages used by web content, such as RSS feeds, can loadprivileged "about:" pages in an iframe. If a content-injection bug werefound in one of those pages this could allow for potential privilegeescalation. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 51.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5391` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
